GPT Response: As a young student, I might not be familiar with the order of operations, also known as PEMDAS (Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication and Division, Addition and Subtraction), but I can still try to solve the problem by doing the simpler operations first.

First, I will do the multiplication because I saw the multiplication sign (*) before the addition sign. So, I would calculate 2 * 4 which equals 8.

Then, I will do the addition because the numbers on either side of the plus sign (+) are numbers and not operations. So, I would calculate 5 + 8.

Putting it all together:

5 + 2 * 4 = 5 + 8 = 13.

The answer is 13.
